required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Pharmacokinetics (PK) and Pharmacodynamics (PD) of Multiple Oral Bedtime Doses of ORMD-0801 in Adult Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM)
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Assess the Safety, PK and PD of Multiple Oral Bedtime Doses of ORMD-0801 in Adult Patients With T2DM Who Are Inadequately Controlled With Diet and Exercise or Diet, Exercise and Metformin

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the safety and pharmacodynamics of an oral formulation of insulin in subjects with Type 2 Diabetes.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single-center, Phase II(a), randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel group, inpatient study preceded by a 5-day single-blind outpatient placebo run-in period.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of ORMD-0801.
primary_outcome.description: Number of Hypoglycemic events, serious adverse events, and adverse events related to the study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: The Effect of ORMD-0801 on Mean Night Time Glucose as Measured by Contiuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Seven (7) days, and last two days (Day 6 and day 7)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between concentration of Nightime Glucose of patients on Placebo and concentration of Nightime Glucose of patients on ORMD-0801

secondary_outcome.measure: The Effect of ORMD-0801 on Mean Daytime Glucose as Measured by Contiuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Seven (7) days, and last two days (Day 6 and day 7)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between concentration of Mean Daytime Glucose of patients on Placebo and concentration of Mean Daytime Glucose of patients on ORMD-0801

secondary_outcome.measure: The Effect of ORMD-0801 on Morning Fasting Serum Insulin
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between concentration of Morning fasting serum insulin of patients on Placebo and concentration of Morning fasting C-peptide of patients on ORMD-0801

secondary_outcome.measure: The Effect of ORMD-0801 on Morning Fasting C-peptide Compared to Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between concentration of Morning fasting C-peptide of patients on Placebo and concentration of Morning fasting C-peptide of patients on ORMD-0801

measure.title: Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of ORMD-0801.
measure.description: Number of Hypoglycemic events, serious adverse events, and adverse events related to the study drug

outcome.title: The Effect of ORMD-0801 on Mean Night Time Glucose as Measured by Contiuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM)
outcome.description: Difference between concentration of Nightime Glucose of patients on Placebo and concentration of Nightime Glucose of patients on ORMD-0801
outcome.time_frame: Seven (7) days, and last two days (Day 6 and day 7)
outcome.population: Per Protocol (PP) population, consisting of all study completers with an endpoint of adequate weighted mean nighttime glucose and no major protocol violations

outcome.title: The Effect of ORMD-0801 on Morning Fasting Serum Insulin
outcome.description: Difference between concentration of Morning fasting serum insulin of patients on Placebo and concentration of Morning fasting C-peptide of patients on ORMD-0801
outcome.population: Modified intention-to-treat (mITT) population consisting of all randomized patients who took at least one dose of study medication and who had at least one night of CGM monitoring

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
